definition: lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
crane
cry of a crane or wild goose

sentences.english: But banks are so gun-shy now that no one would touch us.
sentences.chinese: 但现在银行如此风声鹤唳，没有银行搭理我们。

sentences.english: On top of that, many investors were gun-shy about another Dennis comeback.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯再次回到交易界，这让很多投资者风声鹤唳。

sentences.english: A guilty man apprehends danger in every sound.
sentences.chinese: 犯了罪的人对每一个声音都感到风声鹤唳。

sentences.english: It is also jittery about the "Occupy" movement that has been sweeping the West.
sentences.chinese: 席卷西方的“占领”运动也使政府感到风声鹤唳。

sentences.english: All of this has made us gun-shy about future supply predictions.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些已经使我们对未来供应预测变得风声鹤唳。

definition: lit. every tree or bush an enemy soldier (idiom); fig. to panic and treat everyone as an enemy/to feel beleaguered
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
alarmed/anxious
lit. as if walking on thin ice (idiom)/fig. to be extremely cautious/to be skating on thin ice
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
lit. plaintive whine of geese (idiom); fig. land swarming with disaster victims/starving people fill the land
anxious/panicky
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
thousands of horses, all mute (idiom); no-one dares to speak out/an atmosphere of political oppression
danger lurks on every side (idiom)
lit. storm clouds approach/troubles lie ahead (idiom)
